results.title: In the Late ’70s, Teen Punks Ruled New York. These Are Their Stories.
results.abstract: High school students spent their nights forging a colorful late-night scene marked by big choruses and few rules. The bands didn’t last, but the taste of art and freedom shaped their lives.

media.caption: From left: Joe Katz, David Scharff and Lori Reese of the Student Teachers, onstage at Trax in 1980. The band inspired Kate Schellenbach, who went on to help found the Beastie Boys the next year.

results.abstract: Researchers who previously revived some brain cells in dead pigs succeeded in repeating the process in more organs.

media.caption: Researchers said they hoped to increase the supply of human organs for transplant by allowing doctors to obtain viable organs long after death.

results.title: Kansas Votes to Preserve Abortion Rights Protections in Its Constitution
results.abstract: In the first election test after the U.S. Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, voters overwhelmingly rejected an amendment that would have allowed legislators to enact abortion restrictions.

results.title: Vin Scully, Voice of the Dodgers for 67 Years, Dies at 94
results.abstract: The team has had many great players since World War II, but it was Mr. Scully, a gifted storyteller and a master of the graceful phrase, who became the enduring face of the franchise.

results.title: Don’t Call It a Swimming Pool
results.abstract: Plunge pools have become an alternative for homeowners who want a simple, less expensive way to cool off.

media.caption: “We really wanted just a ‘cocktail pool’ that we could dip in, have some drinks, have some friends over. We just didn’t want a big pool,” said homeowner Amy Holland, whose plunge pool (seen here) did not interfere with the lengthy root system of the 100-year-old live oak on the property.

results.title: With Scully in the Booth, California Baseball Took Root
results.abstract: The Dodgers’ move to Los Angeles was made seamless by a man who never said too much and was perfect for his new surroundings. His old surroundings still miss him.

media.caption: When the Dodgers packed up their things in Brooklyn and headed to Los Angeles, they made sure to take their young announcer, Vin Scully.
